H0.text: Energy is stored between atoms in a chemical substance.

H1.text: Energy is stored on the surface of a chemical substance.

H2.text: In molecules is the storage site of energy in a chemical substance.

H3.text: Inside atoms is where energy is stored in a chemical substance.

A4.text: relatively weakly bonded and unstable molecules store chemical energy.

A5.text: chemical potential energy is a form of potential energy related to the structural arrangement of atoms or molecules.

A6.text: The organic compound norbornadiene converts to quadricyclane upon exposure to light, storing solar energy as the energy of chemical bonds.

A7.text: Food (which is made by the same process as fossil fuels) is a form of energy stored in chemical form.
